lines.text: F = force, q = charge, v = velocity, B = magnetic field, θ = angle between v and B

secText:
Lesson:
1. [OBJ:expsec_45nm:Calculate the force] of a charge moving through a magnetic field when the velocity is not perpendicular to the magnetic field. Calculate the force of a current-carrying wire when the magnetic field is not perpendicular to the force.
2. Calculate the [OBJ:expsec_hj3l:magnetic flux] acting at an angle to the magnetic field.

In-class assessment:
1. [OBJ:qc_38624:Calculate] the force on a current-carrying wire when the force is not perpendicular to the magnetic field.
2. [OBJ:qc_38625:Calculate] the magnetic flux acting at an angle to the magnetic field.
Quick Review: [OBJ:sum_b_force_trig:Magnetic Force with Angle], [OBJ:sum_flux_angle:Flux and Angle]
